trans-unit.source: Using tags to organize your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using tags to organize your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: Shows how to apply tags to organize resources for billing and managing.
trans-unit.target: Shows how to apply tags to organize resources for billing and managing.

trans-unit.source: Using tags to organize your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using tags to organize your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager enables you to logically organize resources by applying tags.
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager enables you to logically organize resources by applying tags.

trans-unit.source: The tags consist of key/value pairs that identify resources with properties that you define.
trans-unit.target: The tags consist of key/value pairs that identify resources with properties that you define.

trans-unit.source: To mark resources as belonging to the same category, apply the same tag to those resources.
trans-unit.target: To mark resources as belonging to the same category, apply the same tag to those resources.

trans-unit.source: When you view resources with a particular tag, you see resources from all of your resource groups.
trans-unit.target: When you view resources with a particular tag, you see resources from all of your resource groups.

trans-unit.source: You are not limited to only resources in the same resource group which enables you to organize your resources in a way that is independent of the deployment relationships.
trans-unit.target: You are not limited to only resources in the same resource group which enables you to organize your resources in a way that is independent of the deployment relationships.

trans-unit.source: Tags can be particularly helpful when you need to organize resources for billing or management.
trans-unit.target: Tags can be particularly helpful when you need to organize resources for billing or management.

trans-unit.source: Each tag you add to a resource or resource group is automatically added to the subscription-wide taxonomy.
trans-unit.target: Each tag you add to a resource or resource group is automatically added to the subscription-wide taxonomy.

trans-unit.source: You can also prepopulate the taxonomy for your subscription with tag names and values you'd like to use as resources are tagged in the future.
trans-unit.target: You can also prepopulate the taxonomy for your subscription with tag names and values you'd like to use as resources are tagged in the future.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can only apply tags to resources that support Resource Manager operations.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can only apply tags to resources that support Resource Manager operations.

trans-unit.source: If you created a Virtual Machine, Virtual Network, or Storage through the classic deployment model (such as through the Azure portal or [Service Management API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn948465.aspx)), you cannot apply a tag to that resource.
trans-unit.target: If you created a Virtual Machine, Virtual Network, or Storage through the classic deployment model (such as through the Azure portal or [Service Management API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn948465.aspx)), you cannot apply a tag to that resource.

trans-unit.source: You must re-deploy these resources through Resource Manager to support tagging.
trans-unit.target: You must re-deploy these resources through Resource Manager to support tagging.

trans-unit.source: All other resources support tagging.
trans-unit.target: All other resources support tagging.

trans-unit.source: Tags in the preview portal
trans-unit.target: Tags in the preview portal

trans-unit.source: Tagging resources and resource groups in the preview portal is easy.
trans-unit.target: Tagging resources and resource groups in the preview portal is easy.

trans-unit.source: Use the Browse hub to navigate to the resource or resource group you’d like to tag and click the Tags part in the Overview section at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the Browse hub to navigate to the resource or resource group you’d like to tag and click the Tags part in the Overview section at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Tags part on resource and resource group blades
trans-unit.target: Tags part on resource and resource group blades

trans-unit.source: This will open a blade with the list of tags that have already been applied.
trans-unit.target: This will open a blade with the list of tags that have already been applied.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first tag, the list will be empty.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first tag, the list will be empty.

trans-unit.source: To add a tag, simply specify a name and value and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: To add a tag, simply specify a name and value and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: After you've added a few tags, you'll notice autocomplete options based on pre-existing tag names and values to better ensure a consistent taxonomy across your resources and to avoid common mistakes, like misspellings.
trans-unit.target: After you've added a few tags, you'll notice autocomplete options based on pre-existing tag names and values to better ensure a consistent taxonomy across your resources and to avoid common mistakes, like misspellings.

trans-unit.source: Tag resources with name/value pairs
trans-unit.target: Tag resources with name/value pairs

trans-unit.source: To view your taxonomy of tags in the portal, use the Browse hub to view Everything and then select Tags.
trans-unit.target: To view your taxonomy of tags in the portal, use the Browse hub to view Everything and then select Tags.

trans-unit.source: Find tags via the Browse hub
trans-unit.target: Find tags via the Browse hub

trans-unit.source: Pin the most important tags to your Startboard for quick access and you're ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Pin the most important tags to your Startboard for quick access and you're ready to go.

trans-unit.source: Have fun!
trans-unit.target: Have fun!

trans-unit.source: Pin tags to the Startboard
trans-unit.target: Pin tags to the Startboard

trans-unit.source: Tagging with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Tagging with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see [Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager](../powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see [Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager](../powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this article, we'll assume you've already added an account and selected a subscription with the resources you want to tag.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this article, we'll assume you've already added an account and selected a subscription with the resources you want to tag.

trans-unit.source: Tagging is only available for resources and resource groups available from [Resource Manager](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx), so the next thing we need to do is switch to use Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Tagging is only available for resources and resource groups available from [Resource Manager](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx), so the next thing we need to do is switch to use Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Tags exist directly on resources and resource groups, so to see what tags are already applied, we can simply get a resource or resource group with `Get-AzureResource` or `Get-AzureResourceGroup`, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Tags exist directly on resources and resource groups, so to see what tags are already applied, we can simply get a resource or resource group with `Get-AzureResource` or `Get-AzureResourceGroup`, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Let's start with a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Let's start with a resource group.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet returns several bits of metadata on the resource group including what tags have been applied, if any.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet returns several bits of metadata on the resource group including what tags have been applied, if any.

trans-unit.source: To tag a resource group, simply use the `Set-AzureResourceGroup` command and specify a tag name and value.
trans-unit.target: To tag a resource group, simply use the `Set-AzureResourceGroup` command and specify a tag name and value.

trans-unit.source: Tags are updated as a whole, so if you are adding one tag to a resource that's already been tagged, you'll need to use an array with all the tags you want to keep.
trans-unit.target: Tags are updated as a whole, so if you are adding one tag to a resource that's already been tagged, you'll need to use an array with all the tags you want to keep.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you can first select the existing tags and add a new one.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you can first select the existing tags and add a new one.

trans-unit.source: To remove one or more tags, simply save the array without the ones you want to remove.
trans-unit.target: To remove one or more tags, simply save the array without the ones you want to remove.

trans-unit.source: The process is the same for resources, except you'll use the `Get-AzureResource` and `Set-AzureResource` cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: The process is the same for resources, except you'll use the `Get-AzureResource` and `Set-AzureResource` cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: To get resources or resource groups with a specific tag, use `Get-AzureResource` or `Get-AzureResourceGroup` cmdlet with the `-Tag` parameter.
trans-unit.target: To get resources or resource groups with a specific tag, use `Get-AzureResource` or `Get-AzureResourceGroup` cmdlet with the `-Tag` parameter.

trans-unit.source: To get a list of all tags within a subscription using PowerShell, use the `Get-AzureTag` cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To get a list of all tags within a subscription using PowerShell, use the `Get-AzureTag` cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You may see tags that start with "hidden-" and "link:".
trans-unit.target: You may see tags that start with "hidden-" and "link:".

trans-unit.source: These are internal tags, which you should ignore and avoid changing.
trans-unit.target: These are internal tags, which you should ignore and avoid changing.

trans-unit.source: Use the `New-AzureTag` cmdlet to add new tags to the taxonomy.
trans-unit.target: Use the `New-AzureTag` cmdlet to add new tags to the taxonomy.

trans-unit.source: These tags will be included in the autocomplete even though they haven't been applied to any resources or resource groups, yet.
trans-unit.target: These tags will be included in the autocomplete even though they haven't been applied to any resources or resource groups, yet.

trans-unit.source: To remove a tag name/value, first remove the tag from any resources it may be used with and then use the `Remove-AzureTag` cmdlet to remove it from the taxonomy.
trans-unit.target: To remove a tag name/value, first remove the tag from any resources it may be used with and then use the `Remove-AzureTag` cmdlet to remove it from the taxonomy.

trans-unit.source: Tagging with REST API
trans-unit.target: Tagging with REST API

trans-unit.source: The portal and PowerShell both use the [Resource Manager REST API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx) behind the scenes.
trans-unit.target: The portal and PowerShell both use the [Resource Manager REST API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx) behind the scenes.

trans-unit.source: If you need to integrate tagging into another environment, you can get tags with a GET on the resource id and update the set of tags with a PATCH call.
trans-unit.target: If you need to integrate tagging into another environment, you can get tags with a GET on the resource id and update the set of tags with a PATCH call.

trans-unit.source: Tagging and billing
trans-unit.target: Tagging and billing

trans-unit.source: For supported services, you can use tags to group your billing data.
trans-unit.target: For supported services, you can use tags to group your billing data.

trans-unit.source: For example, [Virtual Machines integrated with Azure Resource Manager](/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-azurerm-versus-azuresm.md) enable
trans-unit.target: For example, [Virtual Machines integrated with Azure Resource Manager](/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-azurerm-versus-azuresm.md) enable

trans-unit.source: you to define and apply tags to organize the billing usage for virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: you to define and apply tags to organize the billing usage for virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you are running multiple VMs for different organizations, you can use the tags to group usage by cost center.
trans-unit.target: If you are running multiple VMs for different organizations, you can use the tags to group usage by cost center.

trans-unit.source: You can also use tags to categorize costs by runtime environment; such as, the billing usage for VMs running in production environment.
trans-unit.target: You can also use tags to categorize costs by runtime environment; such as, the billing usage for VMs running in production environment.

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve information about tags through the [usage api](billing-usage-rate-card-overview.md) or the usage comma-separated values (CSV) file that you can download from
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve information about tags through the [usage api](billing-usage-rate-card-overview.md) or the usage comma-separated values (CSV) file that you can download from

trans-unit.source: the [Azure accounts portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/) or [EA portal](https://ea.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: the [Azure accounts portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/) or [EA portal](https://ea.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: For more information about programmatic access to billing information, see [Gain insights into your Microsoft Azure resource consumption](billing-usage-rate-card-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about programmatic access to billing information, see [Gain insights into your Microsoft Azure resource consumption](billing-usage-rate-card-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: When you download the usage CSV for services that support tags with billing, the tags will appear in the **Tags** column.
trans-unit.target: When you download the usage CSV for services that support tags with billing, the tags will appear in the **Tags** column.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see [Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure](billing-understand-your-bill.md).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see [Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure](billing-understand-your-bill.md).

trans-unit.source: See tags in billing
trans-unit.target: See tags in billing

trans-unit.target: For an introduction to using the preview portal, see [Using the Azure preview portal to manage your Azure resources](./resource-group-portal.md)
